name: s3://eodata/CLMS/bio-geophysical/vegetation_properties/lai_global_300m_10daily_v2
browserSearchPath: CLMS Bio-geophysical Parameters, Vegetation, Vegetation Properties
collectionDescription: Provides information of Leaf Area Index, defined as half the total area of green elements of the canopy per unit horizontal ground area. Every 10-days estimates are available at global scale in the spatial resolution of ~300 m from January 2014 to the present. More information here.

layers.longDescription: LAI (Leaf Area Index) is defined as half the total area of green elements of the canopy per unit horizontal ground area. It is expressed in m²/m².

layers.shortDescription: Root Mean Square Error on Leaf Area Index
layers.longDescription: RMSE is computed between the final dekadal LAI value and the available valid instantaneous values in the compositing window. It is expressed in [m²/m²].

layers.shortDescription: Number of available valid instantaneous LAI
layers.longDescription: Number of available valid instantaneous LAI values in the compositing window. The more instantaneous values the more reliable is the LAI product.

layers.shortDescription: Length of the semi-period before the date [days]
layers.longDescription: Length of the semi-period before the dekadal date of the compositing window [days].

layers.shortDescription: Length of the semi-period after the date [days]
layers.longDescription: Length of the semi-period after the dekadal date of the compositing window [days].
